data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Haryana government has hiked the Dearness Allowance (DA) of its employees drawing salaries as per the 7th Pay Commission by 4% to 38%. The increased DA will be paid with salaries of October 2022 while arrears for the July-September 2022 period will be paid in November 2022. The Centre had also hiked DA of its employees by 4% in September.
data.title: Haryana government hikes Dearness Allowance by 4% to 38%

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Facebook parent Meta has agreed to sell the GIF creation platform, Giphy, two years after acquiring it in a reported $400 million deal. This comes after the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) ordered Meta to sell Giphy on Tuesday after its view that the acquisition reduced innovation in the advertising market. "We are disappointed by the decision," Meta said.
data.title: Meta accepts UK's order to sell Giphy

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Updating its employee FAQ page, Twitter reportedly informed its employees that they won't be able to access or trade shares from the Equity Award Center. As per a report, this was done "in anticipation of the closing of the pending acquisition of Twitter" by Elon Musk. Twitter and Musk have been directed to close the deal on October 28.
data.title: Twitter locks staff stock accounts in anticipation of deal closure: Report

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to reveal that the firm is losing approximately $20 million per month on Starlink in Ukraine due to "unpaid service and costs related to enhanced security measures for cyberwar defense". "But we will keep doing it," he added. Musk also claimed that the defense department has not given money for the service.
data.title: SpaceX is losing $20 million/month on Starlink in Ukraine: Musk

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Ambuja Cement on Tuesday said it has issued 47.74 crore warrants at a price band of ₹418.87 to Adani family firm Harmonia Trade and Investment and raised ₹5,000 crore. The warrants, issued on preferential basis to Harmonia, have a face value of ₹2. Harmonia Trade and Investment has until now paid ₹104.72/warrant, which is around 25% of the issue price.
data.title: Ambuja Cement raises ₹5,000 crore through Adani's family firm

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: IT company Cognizant has begun rolling out annual salary hikes for its employees, reportedly ranged between 7% to 10%. This comes after Wipro, TCS and Infosys rolled out hikes recently. Last week, Cognizant told its employees that "formal eLetters" with new compensation would be out through the week and the hike would take effect for levels up to associate director.
data.title: Cognizant rolls out salary hikes for employees after Wipro & TCS

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Tech Mahindra has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government under the latter's Employment Generation Incentive and the 'Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Sahay Yojana'. The IT giant plans to hire over 3,000 professionals in Gujarat over the next five years. Tech Mahindra's MoU is one among the 15 MoUs signed by Gujarat government with domestic and global IT companies.
data.title: Tech Mahindra signs MoU with Guj; to hire 3,000 employees in 5 yrs

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Edtech startup Byju's standalone business, comprising K-12 (kindergarten to class 12) offerings, posted a loss of ₹2,702.14 crore in FY21 against a profit of ₹7.39 crore in FY20 with revenues falling over 30% during the year, the company's recent filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs showed. Revenue from operations fell to ₹1,378.51 crore from ₹1,918.25 crore a year earlier.
data.title: Byju's standalone business posted loss in FY21 with 30% revenue drop

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said a key conspirator in the ₹1,257-crore Syndicate Bank (now called Canara Bank) fraudulent loan case has been arrested. "The accused, identified as Himanshu Verma...a resident of Chandigarh, was arrested on October 15," the ED said. Verma was produced before a court in Jaipur and was sent to police custody for 10 days, it added.
data.title: Key conspirator in ₹1,257-cr Syndicate Bank fraud case arrested: ED

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: French cement maker Lafarge has pleaded guilty to a US charge of providing material support to terrorist organisations. Further, it has agreed to pay $777 million in forfeiture and fines as part of its plea agreement with the US government. US prosecutors said that Lafarge paid Islamic State and al Nusra Front, through intermediaries, the equivalent of approximately $5.92 million.
data.title: Lafarge fined $777 million, pleads guilty to paying millions to ISIS

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Tata Communications on Tuesday reported a 25.1% surge in its consolidated net profit for the September quarter at ₹532 crore from ₹425 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations was ₹4,431 crore, a 6.2% increase as against ₹4,174 crore in the same quarter last year. Data business revenues were at ₹3,493 crore, a 4.6% increase quarter-on-quarter.
data.title: Tata Communications' Q2 net profit rises by 25% to ₹532 crore

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Piramal Pharma Limited will list its shares on Wednesday at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. PEL's shareholders have been allotted four shares of Piramal Pharma for every one share in PEL in addition to PEL's existing holding.
data.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares at face value of ₹10 each today

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said that the government should focus on privatisation of state-run companies instead of chasing high divestment targets. "We should actually have moderate targets and more focus should be on privatising," he said. Indian government has set a ₹650 billion divestment and privatisation target for 2022-23.
data.title: Govt should set moderate divestment targets: DIPAM Secretary

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: Lulu Group Director of Marketing and Communications V Nandakumar said it was planning to invest  ₹3,000 crore to set up India’s biggest shopping mall at Ahmedabad. He said the construction of the mall will begin early next year. The mall, which would have all modern facilities, would give direct and indirect employment to 6,000 and 12,000 people, respectively.
data.title: Lulu Group to invest ₹3,000 crore to build India’s biggest mall at Ahmedabad

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Biscuit maker Parle Products' Senior Category Head B Krishna Rao on Tuesday said though there was discussion some time back regarding acquisition of Polish biscuit and cookies firm dr Gerard, "nothing has materialised as yet". Reports had earlier claimed that Parle is in talks with private equity firm Bridgepoint for dr Gerard's acquisition. Bridgepoint had bought dr Gerard in 2013.
data.title: Nothing has materialised on acquisition of dr Gerard as yet: Parle

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: New Zealand's inflation remained near a 32-year high in the third quarter as annual inflation eased to 7.2% from 7.3% in the second quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Tuesday. Consumer prices rose 2.2% in the last quarter. Earlier, New Zealand's Reserve Bank had predicted inflation would drop to 6.4%, while economists expected the rate to drop to 6.5%.
data.title: New Zealand's inflation stays near 32-year high at 7.2% in Q3

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: Adani Group's wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Defence & Aerospace, said it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore. According to the statement, Air Works is India's oldest maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) organisation with six maintenance bays and over 900 maintenance experts. Indian MRO market is expected to grow three times by 2030, the company highlighted.
data.title: Adani Defence & Aerospace to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: The Vodafone Idea board will consider and evaluate a proposal for the issuance of convertible debentures to a vendor on Friday. As of the June quarter, Vodafone Idea's overall debt stood at ₹1.98 lakh crore. A convertible debenture is a long-term debt issued by a company that can be converted into shares of equity stock after a specified period.
data.title: Vodafone Idea board to consider fund raise via convertible debentures

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson on Tuesday said the airline aims to have 30% share in both domestic and international markets in the next five years. Wilson said the airline wants to restore its reputation, adding, "We've evidence to indicate that the progress is being made." Air India was taken over by Tata group in January 2022 for ₹18,000 crore.
data.title: Air India aims 30% domestic, international market share in 5yrs: CEO

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: Kotak Investment Advisors, backed by Uday Kotak, is looking to raise about $1 billion for a new fund for investing in India's residential real estate, according to reports. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and Allianz SE could reportedly invest $500 million and $220 million in the fund, respectively. Kotak Investment is also in advanced talks with other investors for fundraising.
data.title: Kotak Investment Advisors looks to raise $1 billion: Report

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: The Finance Ministry has invited suggestions from industry and trade associations regarding direct and indirect taxes for the Union Budget for 2023-24. The ministry said that industry will be required to submit justification for their demands along with the suggestions. The ministry also sought industry suggestions on reducing compliance burdens, providing tax certainty and reducing litigation.
data.title: Finance Ministry invites industry suggestions on taxes for 2023-24 Budget

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government and the private sector will make investments worth about ₹95,000 crore in India's civil aviation sector in next four years. The investments will reportedly be on development of greenfield and brownfield airports. This sector has passed through difficult times and it's now ready for take-off to its true potential, he added.
data.title: About ₹95,000 cr to be invested in aviation sector in 4 yrs: Scindia

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: A recent notification from the market regulator SEBI shows that automobile e-commerce company ﻿Droom has withdrawn its initial public offering. Droom had filed a draft red herring prospectus with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The proposed IPO included fresh issue of shares aggregating ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares aggregating ₹1,000 crore by Droom Pte.
data.title: ﻿Droom withdraws its initial public offering

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Electronics Mart India's stock locked in the 10% upper circuit at ₹92.95/share on NSE on Tuesday, a day after Nippon India Mutual Fund bought an additional 0.6% of its equity stake at an average price of ₹89.42 apiece. In the previous session, which was the first trading day for the stock after IPO, its shares closed at a 43% gain.
data.title: Electronics Mart India shares rise 10% after Nippon India MF buys stake

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Hurun India Founder and MD Anas Rahman Junaid said comic-like books around entrepreneurship and business must be introduced at school level in India to create children's interest in the subject at an early age. "It'll be interesting if someone can put together...something like an Amar Chitra Katha. That should do wonders," Junaid said. "Creating wealth is an art," he added.
data.title: Introduce 'Amar Chitra Katha' for entrepreneurship in school: Hurun India MD

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Kanye West is buying the right-wing social media app Parler, which has been banned by Apple and Google multiple times and was used to coordinate the January 6 Capitol riot. The rapper, known as Ye, said, "In a world where conservative opinions are considered to be controversial we have to make sure we have the right to freely express ourselves."
data.title: Kanye West to buy right-wing social media app Parler

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S, who resigned from Infosys last week, will join Cognizant on January 16, 2023, as President of Cognizant Americas. He will also be joining Cognizant's executive committee and will be based in New York, as per reports. Kumar has over 20 years of experience in the consulting, process and technology transformation space.
data.title: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S to join Cognizant to lead its Americas market

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Speaking on the issue of moonlighting, TCS COO N Ganapathy Subramaniam said that it is important to show empathy when dealing with such a matter. He said, "Nothing prevents the country's biggest IT services exporter from taking action against employees for moonlighting when it has evidence…The consequence (of taking action) will be that the person's career will be ruined."
data.title: Action against moonlighting can ruin a person's career: TCS COO

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Updating its employee FAQ page, Twitter reportedly informed its employees that they won't be able to access or trade shares from the Equity Award Center. As per a report, this was done "in anticipation of the closing of the pending acquisition of Twitter" by Elon Musk. Twitter and Musk have been directed to close the deal on October 28.
data.title: Twitter locks staff stock accounts in anticipation of deal closure: Report

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content:
Microsoft has fired around 1,000 employees across several divisions this week, as per Axios. The job cuts affected less than 1% of Microsoft's total workforce of around 2,21,000 as of June 30.
Microsoft in a statement said,  "Like all companies, we evaluate our business priorities on a regular basis, and make structural adjustments accordingly."
data.title: Microsoft fires around 1,000 employees across several divisions: Report

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: An unopened first-generation iPhone from 2007 was auctioned for $39,339.60 by US-based LCG Auctions. When it was first released, the phone was priced at $499 to $599 and has now fetched over 60 times that price at the auction. The unused 8GB iPhone came with a 3.5-inch screen, a 2-megapixel camera, and a web browser.
data.title: Sealed iPhone from 2007 sells for $39,000 at auction, over 60 times its original price

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: In a Facebook post, Meta chief Mark Zuckerberg remarked, "WhatsApp is far more private and secure than iMessage, with end-to-end encryption that works across both iPhones and Android, including group chats." Sharing a picture of a Meta ad, he wrote, "With WhatsApp, you can...set all new chats to disappear with the tap of a button...We introduced end-to-end encrypted backups too."
data.title: WhatsApp is far more private & secure than iMessage: Mark Zuckerberg

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Elon Musk took to Twitter to share a meme featuring him, former US President Donald Trump and rapper Kanye West. The meme named the social media apps Parler and Truth Social, owned by Kanye and Trump, respectively. It also bore the alphabet 'X', a super app that Musk wants Twitter to transform into, once he buys the platform.
data.title: Musk shares meme featuring him, Kanye & Trump with their social media apps

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Some Apple users complained about the 'SIM not supported' bug on iPhone 14 recently. As per a memo seen by MacRumors, Apple acknowledged the SIM-related bug in some iPhone 14 devices and stated that after displaying the pop-up message on the screen, the iPhone may entirely freeze. Apple said that while it's investigating the issue, it isn't a hardware problem.
data.title: Some iPhone 14 users complain of 'SIM not supported' bug, Apple says probing issue

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Facebook parent Meta has agreed to sell the GIF creation platform, Giphy, two years after acquiring it in a reported $400 million deal. This comes after the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) ordered Meta to sell Giphy on Tuesday after its view that the acquisition reduced innovation in the advertising market. "We are disappointed by the decision," Meta said.
data.title: Meta accepts UK's order to sell Giphy

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Apple on Tuesday unveiled the next-generation iPad and iPad Pro. While both iPad and iPad Pro run on iPadOS 16, the iPad features an A14 Bionic chip with a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, an Ultra Wide 12 MP front camera and a 12MP back camera. The iPad Pro runs on an M2 Bionic chip and features a new Reference Mode.
data.title: Apple unveils iPad with A14 chip, iPad Pro with M2 chip

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: YouTube has ended a trial wherein some users were asked to become Premium subscribers to watch videos in 4K resolution. "We've fully turned off this experiment. Viewers should now be able to access 4K quality resolutions without Premium membership," a Twitter account of YouTube said. YouTube had launched the trial to know "the feature preferences of Premium and non-Premium viewers".
data.title: YouTube ends trial that made 4K videos exclusive to Premium users

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Apple has frozen its plans to use memory chips from China's Yangtze Memory Technologies amid increasing political pressure, Nikkei Asia reported citing sources. Apple had originally planned to use YMTC's NAND flash memory chips as early as 2022. The US has added YMTC and 30 other firms to a list of companies that it has been unable to inspect.
data.title: Apple freezes plans to use China-based YMTC's chips: Report

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Meta's India unit posted a 132% surge in its net profit at ₹297 crore for the financial year 2021-22 as against ₹128.2 crore a year ago. Its total income grew to ₹2,324 crore, which is a 56.5% surge from ₹1,485.1 crore in the previous fiscal. The gross advertising revenue increased 74% year-on-year to ₹16,189 crore during the said period.
data.title: Meta India posts 132% surge in net profit at ₹297 crore for FY22

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Apple's virtual reality XR headset will include sensors that work like Face ID and offer iris-scanning technology, according to reports. The new technology, called 'Iris ID', would enable users to log in to their accounts and make payments biometrically. The headset reportedly has over 10 cameras and might be powered by M2 chip, same as that used in MacBook Air.
data.title: Apple's VR headset to let users log in, make payments biometrically: Report

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: A hacker who stole about $100 million from decentralised-finance (DeFi) application Mango got to keep around $50 million of the funds in various crypto assets after returning the rest on Saturday. The hacker had demanded erasure of bad debts. Mango's team then offered to let the hacker keep $50 million while promising no criminal prosecution and erasure of bad debt.
data.title: Hacker who stole $100 mn from DeFi app Mango gets to keep $50 mn

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: A Russian court on Tuesday fined US-based e-commerce firm Amazon 4 million roubles (about $65,000) in two separate cases, Interfax reported. The court ruled that Amazon had failed to delete material relating to drug use and "propagandising suicide", both of which are illegal under Russian law. This is the first fine Amazon has faced in Russia.
data.title: Russia fines Amazon 4 mn roubles for not deleting illegal content: Report

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: IT company Cognizant has begun rolling out annual salary hikes for its employees, reportedly ranged between 7% to 10%. This comes after Wipro, TCS and Infosys rolled out hikes recently. Last week, Cognizant told its employees that "formal eLetters" with new compensation would be out through the week and the hike would take effect for levels up to associate director.
data.title: Cognizant rolls out salary hikes for employees after Wipro & TCS

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Tech Mahindra has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government under the latter's Employment Generation Incentive and the 'Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Sahay Yojana'. The IT giant plans to hire over 3,000 professionals in Gujarat over the next five years. Tech Mahindra's MoU is one among the 15 MoUs signed by Gujarat government with domestic and global IT companies.
data.title: Tech Mahindra signs MoU with Guj; to hire 3,000 employees in 5 yrs

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said the company "will add a donate option to Starlink". His remark came in response to a tweet by CEO of a fintech firm who said he'd like to donate Starlink's satellite internet service to schools and hospitals in Uganda. Musk then tweeted, "Are there others [who] want to donate Starlinks to places in need?"
data.title: We will add donate option to Starlink: Elon Musk

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: As it ramps up electric vehicle manufacturing, Foxconn says it wants to replicate its level of success in assembling consumer gadgets. Chairman Liu Young-way said, "Hope one day we can do Tesla cars for Tesla," adding, "Ambitions-wise, hopefully we're able to achieve the same kind of achievement like in ICT industry, but we'll start small...which is about 5% in 2025".
data.title: Hope to make cars for Tesla one day: Foxconn Chairman Liu Young-way

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Microsoft failed to protect millions of Windows users against malicious drivers as it didn't update the list of affected drivers in nearly three years, according to a report by Ars Technica. Exploiting the vulnerability, cybercriminals can take control of users' devices using a technique called 'BYOVD'. "Microsoft is...aware of BYOVD threat and has been working on defences," the report said.
data.title: Windows failed to protect users against malicious drivers: Report

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' family has announced that they would donate $710.5 million over the next decade to Fred Hutchinson Cancer Centre in US' Seattle. The donation will fund recruitment of 36 new researchers, construction of a new 3.9 lakh-square-foot research building and expansion of immunotherapy research. It'll also fund expansion of institution-wide clinical research capabilities.
data.title: Bezos family to donate $710.5 mn to cancer centre in US' Seattle

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India's sustained economic growth has been possible due to the BJP government's efforts to replace pre-2014 'phone banking' with 'digital banking'. Under 'phone banking', instructions were given to banks on phones, PM Modi said. Any country's economy is as progressive as its banking sector's strength, he added.
data.title: Replacing 'phone banking' with 'digital banking' promoted growth: PM

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Telegram has been fined $5 million by Germany for not establishing a lawful way for reporting illegal content and not naming an entity in Germany to receive official communication. Officials said they've repeatedly failed in their attempts to serve papers to Dubai-based Telegram, despite support from UAE authorities. Telegram is becoming "medium for radicalisation", German police had said earlier.
data.title: Germany fines Telegram $5 mn for not establishing way to report content

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has stated that he is not sure if he has ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli. "What he does in ODI cricket is unbelievable. His records are amazing," Ponting added. Ponting also praised Kohli for his captaincy, saying, "He led his team really well. The win in Test series in Australia was amazing."
data.title: Not sure if I have ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli: Ponting

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Olympic medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifted actor Aparshakti Khurana at an event recently. Sharing pictures, she joked, "Hey @aparshakti_khurana sir let's do a complete CLEAN AND JERK the next time we meet." Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "She did not put any real efforts into lifting him. That was so easy for her." Another wrote, "So effortless."
data.title: Weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifts actor Aparshakti Khurana, shares pics

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Pakistan have reportedly threatened to pull out of 2023 World Cup in India after BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said India won't travel to Pakistan for 2023 Asia Cup. "PCB is...prepared to take hard decisions and play hard ball because it's...aware...ICC and ACC events will...face commercial liabilities and losses if Pakistan don't play India in these...events," a PCB source told PTI.
data.title: Pak threaten to pull out of 2023 WC if India don't travel to Pak for Asia Cup: Reports

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique celebrated smashing the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 by flexing his muscles. A video of the same has gone viral. Siddique slammed a 109-metre maximum off Sri Lanka's Dushmantha Chameera to set the record. The previous biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 was hit by Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit (94 metres).
data.title: UAE's Junaid celebrates hitting biggest six of T20 WC 2022 by flexing muscles, video viral

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli laughing at Dinesh Karthik after the latter stared at Arshdeep Singh for a stray throw during their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match. In the video, Karthik can be seen staring at Arshdeep for 7-8 seconds, seemingly unhappy with the throw. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Sources say...he's still seeing there."
data.title: Kohli laughs at Karthik for staring at Arshdeep over stray throw, video viral

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Newly-elected BCCI President Roger Binny said he'd primarily focus on reducing injuries to players and improving pitches in India. Roger said injury to Jasprit Bumrah just before T20 World Cup 2022 affected Team India's "whole plan". He added, "There needs to be more life in...wickets at home, so our teams wouldn't have the problem of adjusting when travelling abroad."
data.title: Will work on reducing injuries to players, improving pitches: BCCI President Roger Binny

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Manchester United have been charged by the Football Association (FA) after their players surrounded referee Craig Pawson during Sunday's Premier League match against Newcastle. The players reacted angrily after Pawson disallowed a goal from Cristiano Ronaldo. United failed to ensure its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion, the FA said.
data.title: Manchester United charged by FA over players' reaction to Ronaldo's disallowed goal

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Indonesia will demolish and rebuild the football stadium where over 130 people were killed in a stampede earlier this month. Indonesia President Joko Widodo said they will build Kanjuruhan Stadium in Malang according to FIFA standards. A fact-finding team formed by Indonesian government concluded that "excessive" and "indiscriminate" use of teargas by police was the leading cause of death.
data.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where over 130 people died in stampede

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Actor and WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram to share an old picture of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips celebrating his T20I hundred against West Indies in 2020. His post comes amid T20 World Cup 2022 being held in Australia. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So...John Cena is the third umpire?" Another wrote, "Do you watch cricket?"
data.title: John Cena shares old pic of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips on Instagram

data.author: Ankur Taliyan
data.content: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said Virat Kohli will be "very pro" in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Kohli will be ready to go. [Nothing] charges or fires him up like playing in Australia. He loves playing in front of Australian crowds," stated Shastri. Kohli has scored a century and four fifties in 14 T20Is this year so far.
data.title: Nothing charges or fires Kohli up like playing in Australia: Shastri

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Ahead of West Indies' Group B match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022, West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder said his side has what it takes to turn it around following their "disappointing" performance against Scotland. "We obviously didn't bat well yesterday," he added. West Indies lost the match by 42 runs. They will face Zimbabwe on Wednesday.
data.title: WI have what it takes to turn it around: Holder ahead of Zimbabwe game

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: After Sri Lanka's 79-run win over UAE in T20 World Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said he's disappointed with his side scoring 152/8 in 20 overs as they could've scored 180-190. "Tone was set upfront, but Bhanu (Bhanuka Rajapaksa) and I didn't click," he added. Sri Lanka are currently placed third in Group A standings.
data.title: We could've scored 180-190: SL skipper Shanaka after win vs UAE in T20 WC

data.author: Ankur Taliyan
data.content: Talking about India's chances of reaching the semi-finals of the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-India captain Kapil Dev said, "For me, it's just 30%." He added, "In T20 cricket, team winning a match can lose the next...And I'm concerned about their making it to the top four." India were knocked out in the group stage of the 2021 World Cup.
data.title: It's just 30%: Kapil Dev on India's chances of reaching semis in T20 WC

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Reacting to UAE spinner Karthik Meiyappan's hat-trick against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "That's a quality hat-trick. Congratulations...Meiyappan, something to cherish for [a] lifetime." UAE skipper CP Rizwan said, "He bowled beautifully...He's a special bowler." The 22-year-old dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and captain Dasun Shanaka.
data.title: Something to cherish for lifetime: Jaffer on Meiyappan's hat-trick in T20 WC

data.author: Aditya Nair
data.content: Brazilian footballer Neymar Jr told a court he did not participate in negotiations over his transfer to Barcelona from Santos in 2013. "My father always took care of it...I sign everything he tells me to sign," he said. The case is based on allegations made by an investment firm that it lost out on its rightful cut from the transfer.
data.title: My father took care of everything: Neymar during Barca transfer trial

data.author: Mohammad Anab
data.content: After India crashed out of the FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup, the team's head coach Thomas Dennerby said that five months of preparation was not enough to get ready for the tournament. "It is always painful to leave...in the group stage...[but] I am still proud of the girls because they were putting in the extra effort," Dennerby said.
data.title: 5 months of preparation was not enough for FIFA U-17 Women's WC: India coach

data.author: Mohammad Anab
data.content: Ex-Australian hockey skipper Mark Knowles said that the Indian men's hockey team is extremely hard to be defeated on home soil and in front of their "passionate" fans. "I believe that any of the top seven or eight teams...could win the World Cup. I think the top, the top two in my eyes are still Belgium and Australia," Knowles said.
data.title: Ind hockey team hard to beat on home soil: Ex-Aus skipper Knowles

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol and rifle teams won gold medals at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Tuesday. Esha Singh, Shikha Narwal and Varsha Singh beat China 16-6 in air pistol gold medal match, while Tilottama Sen, Nancy and Ramita beat China 16-2 in air rifle. India have won nine gold, three silver and eight bronze medals.
data.title: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol, rifle teams win golds at World C'ship

data.author: Aditya Nair
data.content: Former India batter Suresh Raina said if India were to win their T20 World Cup 2022 opening match against Pakistan, then they will "win" the trophy. "The team is doing well right now...if we win the first match, it will set a good tone for us," said Raina. He added Mohammad Shami is "the best option" to replace Jasprit Bumrah.
data.title: If India win against Pakistan, they will win the T20 World Cup 2022: Raina

data.author: Aditya Nair
data.content: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup after suffering a serious calf injury, confirmed Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp. "After such a good night at Anfield mine ended in the worst way! In the last minute one of my dreams collapsed," tweeted Jota. Klopp said the forward would not need surgery but is expected to be sidelined for months.
data.title: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup: Liverpool manager

data.author: Mohammad Anab
data.content: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan batter Saeed Anwar asked when all international teams come to Pakistan, then what is BCCI's problem. "If BCCI is willing to go to a neutral venue, then PCB should also...[do the same] for the 2023 World Cup in India," Anwar said.
data.title: When all teams come to Pakistan then what is BCCI's problem: Anwar

data.author: Aditya Nair
data.content: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said goalkeepers are "overlooked" for strikers when it comes to being awarded the Ballon d'Or. "I couldn't have had a better season...As a keeper, you can't do more...keepers are being underestimated," said Courtois. The Belgian goalkeeper came seventh in Ballon d'Or rankings and also won the 2022 Yashin award for the world's best goalkeeper.
data.title: Goalkeepers overlooked for strikers in Ballon d'Or: Real's Courtois

data.author: Mohammad Anab
data.content: Ex-cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on pacer Mohammad Shami's match-winning final over against Australia in the T20 World Cup warm-up game. "It took just six balls for Shami to show the world that he was right here," Chopra said. He added, "Shami came and bowled yorkers after yorkers. He bowled just one short ball, the rest were all yorkers."
data.title: Took just 6 balls to show the world that he was right here: Chopra on Shami

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Indian duo of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand entered the second round of women's doubles at Denmark Open on Tuesday. Commonwealth Games 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers defeated Alexandra Boje and Amalie Magelund of Denmark 21-15, 21-15 in the first round in 35 minutes. Treesa and Gayatri will now face sixth seeds Jongkolphan Kititharakul and Rawinda Prajongjai.
data.title: Indian duo of Treesa-Gayatri enters 2nd round at Denmark Open

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter after Roger Binny was named the new BCCI President and wrote, "My best wishes to Mr Roger Binny...I'm sure the board will benefit greatly from your experience." He added, "Congratulations dada Sourav Ganguly on the completion of your term as President!" RP Singh tweeted, "Congratulations to the World Cup 1983 hero."
data.title: My best wishes: Yuvraj to Roger Binny on being named new BCCI President

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: After multiple reports claimed that a new COVID-19 strain with an 80% 'kill rate' has been created by researchers at a lab at US' Boston University, the college issued a statement denying them. Calling the reports "false and inaccurate", the university said its research didn't "amplify" the Washington state COVID-19 strain, but rather made "the virus replicate less dangerous".
data.title: COVID strain with 80% kill rate made in US college lab, say reports; university denies

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: Sweden's new government on Tuesday named a 26-year-old as Climate Minister, the youngest person to lead a ministry in the country. Romina Pourmokhtari was until now the head of the Liberal Party's youth wing. Sweden's new government consists of Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson and 23 ministers.
data.title: 26-year-old Romina becomes Sweden's Climate Minister

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: Senior Chinese diplomat Zheng Xiyuan was involved in attacking a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester outside the consulate in Manchester, a British MP alleged. The protester was allegedly pulled by the hair, dragged inside the consulate and beaten by the staff. China has responded to the allegations, saying the protesters 'illegally entered' the consulate and 'violated its peace and dignity'.
data.title: Senior Chinese diplomat attacked Hong Kong protester, says UK MP; China responds

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: Canada has introduced new rules to strengthen protections offered to temporary foreign workers, including protecting them from any abuse, mistreatment or discrimination. Employers will be mandated to inform them about their rights in the country and provide them with health care services. Employers cannot charge recruitment fees to employees and will have to give them mandatory training.
data.title: What are Canada's new rules to protect temporary foreign workers?

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Russia on Tuesday said that the four Ukrainian regions annexed last month are under the protection of its nuclear arsenal. "All these territories [Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia] are inalienable parts of Russia," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.
data.title: Annexed Ukrainian regions protected by nuclear weapons: Russia

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: Russian air strikes disrupted electricity and water supply lines in Ukraine on Tuesday. Zhytomyr city, which is 140 km west of Kyiv, was among those hit with almost the whole city without power and water and hospitals operating on backup power. Missile strikes also targeted energy facilities in Kyiv and Dnipro.
data.title: Russian air strikes target energy facilities in Ukraine

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres has supported Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the present time is "not an era of war". "No time is the time for war. But this time, in particular, is not the time," Guterres said. He also expressed concern over the "large number of civilian victims" in the Russia-Ukraine war.
data.title: No time is the time for war: UN Secy Gen Antonio Guterres

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday said there was "no space left for negotiations" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin following the latest spate of Russian air strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and critical infrastructure. "Since Oct 10, 30% of Ukraine's power stations have been destroyed, causing massive blackouts across the country," Zelenskyy said in a tweet.
data.title: 'No space left for talks': Zelenskyy as Russia targets power infra

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has said that the football stadium where a stampede killed 133 people will be torn down and rebuilt according to FIFA standards. The new stadium will have "proper facilities that can ensure the safety of...players and supporters", he added. The stampede on October 1 happened after police tear-gassed fans who invaded the pitch after a defeat.
data.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where stampede killed 133

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: Former Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard has compared US President Joe Biden to German dictator Adolf Hitler, saying they have a "mindset" which justifies authoritarian behaviour. "I'm pretty sure they all believe they're doing what's best," Gabbard said while comparing the two leaders. Gabbard made the remarks while campaigning for the upcoming midterm elections.
data.title: US President Biden and Hitler share same mindset: Tulsi Gabbard

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Ethiopia's national army has seized control of three towns from regional forces in the rebel-held Tigray province, the federal government said on Tuesday. "The (army) has taken control of...Shire, Alamata, and Korem....," the government stated. The Tigray conflict is a result of rivalries between regional power blocs and disagreement over power sharing between federal and regional authorities.
data.title: Ethiopian army captures 3 towns from rebel forces in Tigray region

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Germany's national cyber security agency BSI's chief Arne Schonbohm was sacked from his post on Tuesday over his alleged links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. While confirming Schonbohm's dismissal, Berlin said the allegations had "permanently damaged" public confidence regarding his integrity. His links to a firm with ties to the Kremlin were highlighted by a comedian.
data.title: Germany's cyber security head sacked over alleged Russian ties

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: A UN peacekeeper who was wounded in an IED attack in northern Mali on Monday has succumbed to his injuries, bringing the death toll to four, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said on Tuesday. MINUSMA had initially put the death toll at two. The incident occurred when a vehicle carrying peacekeepers hit an IED during a mine search and detection patrol.
data.title: Death toll from IED attack on UN peacekeepers in Mali rises to 4

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Japan will impose additional sanctions on North Korea by freezing the assets of groups involved in its missile development programme, a Japanese official said on Tuesday. He stated, "We cannot tolerate North Korea's repeated provocative actions...." This comes following a string of recent ballistic missile tests carried out by Pyongyang, including the one where a projectile was fired over Japan.
data.title: Japan to impose additional sanctions against North Korea

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: The British government on Tuesday said the visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens will be abolished from next month. Guyanese President Irfaan Ali said the government will ensure the system is not abused. British High Commissioner to Guyana Jane Miller said the decision was "a real sign of the confidence the United Kingdom has in the growth of our relationship".
data.title: Britain to abolish visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Leaders of the Palestinian militant group Hamas will visit the Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday, a spokesman of the group said on Tuesday. The Hamas leaders would be led by senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya, Hazem Qassem informed. In 2012, Hamas vacated its Syria headquarters after publicly declaring support for protests against President Bashar al-Assad's government.
data.title: Hamas delegation to visit Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: French cement maker Lafarge has pleaded guilty to a US charge of providing material support to terrorist organisations. Further, it has agreed to pay $777 million in forfeiture and fines as part of its plea agreement with the US government. US prosecutors said that Lafarge paid Islamic State and al Nusra Front, through intermediaries, the equivalent of approximately $5.92 million.
data.title: Lafarge fined $777 million, pleads guilty to paying millions to ISIS

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: Workers across sectors in France went on a strike on Tuesday, demanding hikes in salaries to keep up with rising inflation. The strike call, which was originally given by an oil workers' union, was heeded by transportation workers (including rail and bus), school teachers and hospital employees. News agency Reuters reported clashes between protesters and the police in Paris.
data.title: Workers across sectors strike in France, demand higher wages

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Britain on Tuesday summoned China's Charge d'Affaires over the reports of a pro-democracy protester being assaulted inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester. A video of the incident which shows the man being dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men has gone viral. China's Foreign Ministry has claimed that protesters had broken into the consulate.
data.title: UK summons Chinese diplomat over attack on protester at consulate

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: Danish authorities on Tuesday confirmed that the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea have suffered "extensive damage", saying it was caused by "powerful explosions". Earlier this month, Sweden said its probe into the ruptures detected on the pipelines has "strengthened the suspicions of serious sabotage". Four leaks have been detected on the pipelines so far.
data.title: 'Powerful explosions' damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines: Denmark

data.author: Indraneel Sen
data.content: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has ordered that the country's three active nuclear power plants remain operational till April next year. Germany had earlier announced it would completely phase out the use of nuclear power by the end of this year. However, a shortage in the supply of natural gas, following the Russia-Ukraine war, has resulted in a change of plans.
data.title: Germany to keep nuclear power plants operational till next April

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: At least 23 children have been killed in the protests in Iran, a UN human rights office spokesperson said. Children have been killed due to live ammunition, metal pellets at close range and fatal beatings. An unspecified number of children had been arrested during school raids, the rights office added. Protests were triggered after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini.
data.title: 23 children killed in mass protests in Iran: UN rights office

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: After a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester was allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that "disturbing elements" had illegally entered the consulate. Wang Wenbin declined to confirm or deny whether China's Consul General in Manchester was involved in the incident. British police launched an investigation into the case.
data.title: Disturbing elements illegally entered the Manchester consulate: China

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: One child is being admitted to a health facility for the treatment of "severe acute malnutrition" every minute in Somalia, a UNICEF spokesperson said on Tuesday. This comes as Somalia faces a drought that threatens to cause the deaths of children on a scale that the UNICEF official said has not been witnessed "in half a century".
data.title: 1 child/minute being admitted for malnutrition treatment in Somalia: UNICEF

data.author: Mayukh Debnath
data.content: At least two people were stabbed to death and one person was severely injured during a knife attack in the western German city of Ludwigshafen on Tuesday, police said. The suspected attacker was shot and injured by the police before his arrest, as per media reports. The motive behind the attack was not immediately clear.
data.title: 2 killed, 1 injured in knife attack in German city of Ludwigshafen

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: Actor Suniel Shetty reacted to Byju's firing 2,500 employees in a cost-cutting measure and said, "[It] was a tough one to swallow." Saying that the layoffs likely affected 10,000 people, Shetty, without naming the company, said, "This is a good time for early-stage...businesses to establish a few operating principles...If you're not seeing growth, switch to a survival mindset."
data.title: Switch to survival mindset: Suniel Shetty to startups as Byju's fires 2,500 employees

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: US-based software company Canopy's CEO Davis Bell said he fired two recently hired engineers for moonlighting. He also revealed that he later got a call from someone telling him they hope Bell dies in a car crash. "[The engineers] were following a new trend of picking up a second, full-time job while lying about it to both employers," Bell said.
data.title: Got a call saying 'hope you die': CEO after US firm fires engineers for moonlighting

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: SpaceX, in a letter to the Pentagon, said that it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine. The Elon Musk-led company has requested the US government to take over funding for Ukraine's government and military use of Starlink. SpaceX estimates that providing Starlink in Ukraine will cost more than $120 million for the rest of the year.
data.title: SpaceX says it cannot fund Starlink in Ukraine, seeks funding from US govt

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Software startup Zoho's CEO Sridhar Vembu said that layoffs will be the "absolute last thing" that the company will ever consider. "It kind of destroys loyalty...If we want our employees to be loyal, we have to be loyal to them," the billionaire explained. Vembu further said that even when the times are tough, the company needs to retain its talent.
data.title: Layoffs will be the absolute last thing at Zoho, it destroys loyalty: CEO

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: The shares of Tesla closed down 7.6% to $204.99 on Friday, marking a 50% drop from its all-time high. The stock had closed at a record high of $409.97 on November 4, 2021. The drop took Tesla's market capitalisation to $642 billion. It has reportedly lost about a third of its value in less than a month.
data.title: Tesla shares fall 50% from record high, market cap drops to $642 bn

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: BYJU'S, the world's most-valuable edtech startup, has raised $250 million in a new funding round. Existing investors participated in the round, including Qatar Investment Authority, the startup announced on Monday. The fundraise comes days after BYJU'S announced plans to lay off about 2,500 employees across departments. The layoffs are aimed at cutting costs amid the company's mounting losses.
data.title: BYJU'S raises $250 million days after laying off 2,500 employees

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal asked a custodial manager to run three laps around the Ola Futurefactory in Tamil Nadu as a punishment, Bloomberg reported citing people who were present there at the time. Aggarwal had summoned the custodial manager after spotting a shuttered entryway that should have been left open. Ola claims Futurefactory is the world's largest two-wheeler factory.
data.title: Ola CEO asked a staffer to run 3 laps around the factory for a mistake: Report

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Several former and current employees at Ola Electric have alleged that the company's culture has turned hostile over the last couple of years, Bloomberg reported. They accused Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal of directing Punjabi epithets at staff and calling teams "useless" in meetings. Aggarwal would lose patience over a crooked paper clip or quality of printing paper, the employees claimed.
data.title: Ola CEO called teams 'useless', hurled Punjabi epithets at staff in meetings: Report

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: When asked about his management style at the company, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal remarked, "Not everybody is a fit for our culture". Around 36 employees at Ola Electric and ANI Technologies, reportedly quit within a year or two of joining. A report quoting Ola Electric employees said Aggarwal would call staff "useless" or lose patience in meetings over minor issues.
data.title: Not everybody is a fit for our culture: Ola CEO on his management style

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to reveal that the firm is losing approximately $20 million per month on Starlink in Ukraine due to "unpaid service and costs related to enhanced security measures for cyberwar defense". "But we will keep doing it," he added. Musk also claimed that the defense department has not given money for the service.
data.title: SpaceX is losing $20 million/month on Starlink in Ukraine: Musk

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Edtech unicorn upGrad's Co-founder Ronnie Screwvala told ET NOW in an interview, "Layoffs are unfortunately withdrawal symptoms of founders being on steroids." He said that a company's expansion beyond its scope can also lead to layoffs. Screwvala's comments come soon after BYJU'S said it will lay off 5% of its 50,000 workforce over the next six months.
data.title: Layoffs are withdrawal symptoms of founders on steroids: Ronnie Screwvala

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Uber responded after actress Manava Naik alleged that a Mumbai driver misbehaved with her and threatened her with dire consequences. Calling the incident "deplorable", Uber said it has removed the driver's access to their app. Further, Mumbai Joint Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) said they have taken serious cognisance of the incident and the culprit will be booked soon.
data.title: Uber responds after actress Manava says driver threatened her, calls it 'deplorable'

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail has acquired the e-commerce platform LimeRoad for a lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. V-Mart said that as part of the acquisition, the company is acquiring assets worth ₹14.61 crore and assuming current liabilities of ₹36.26 crore. Founded in 2012, LimeRoad had raised over $51 million altogether and was backed by investors including Tiger Global.
data.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce platform LimeRoad for ₹31 crore

data.author: Nidhi Sinha
data.content: A video of an 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. The automated idli-making machine, which is set up by Bengaluru-based startup Freshot Robotics, can reportedly prepare and dispense 72 packaged idlis and chutney in 12 minutes. The video showed a customer scanning the QR code placed near the ATM to place her order.
data.title: Video of 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru goes viral

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Pentagon's deputy press secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed being in touch with SpaceX after it sought funding for Starlink in Ukraine, adding, "There's not just SpaceX, there are other entities that we can...partner with when it comes to providing Ukraine with what they need on the battlefield." Earlier, SpaceX said it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine.
data.title: There's not just SpaceX: US as startup seeks funding for Starlink in Ukraine

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 mission astronauts have safely returned to Earth from International Space Station. A SpaceX capsule, carrying three NASA astronauts and one European Space Agency's astronaut, splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Florida on Friday. The astronauts returned after spending 170 days in orbit, NASA said. The mission was launched on April 27.
data.title: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 astronauts return to Earth after 170 days

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said the company "will add a donate option to Starlink". His remark came in response to a tweet by CEO of a fintech firm who said he'd like to donate Starlink's satellite internet service to schools and hospitals in Uganda. Musk then tweeted, "Are there others [who] want to donate Starlinks to places in need?"
data.title: We will add donate option to Starlink: Elon Musk

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: Instagram has announced that it is expanding the testing options for its AI-powered age verification feature to India and Brazil. The feature will allow users to upload a video of themselves, which Instagram runs through an AI system to determine whether the user is aged 18 or older. Meta has partnered with Yoti that specialises in AI-based online age verification.
data.title: Instagram introduces AI-powered age verification process in India

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said that Starlink is the only internet service left in Ukraine, and Russia is actively trying to kill it too. "Internet fibre, phone lines, cell towers...have been destroyed. Starlink is all that's left. For now," Musk tweeted. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said Musk is among the world's top private donors supporting Ukraine.
data.title: Russia trying to kill Starlink internet service in Ukraine: Musk

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: The Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) heaviest rocket, LVM3, will launch 36 broadband satellites of the British startup OneWeb in LVM3 – M2/OneWeb India-1 Mission on October 23. The mission, which will be launched from spaceport in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota, will make LVM3 enter the global commercial launch service market. India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor in OneWeb.
data.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket to launch UK startup OneWeb's 36 satellites

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: The Karnataka High Court has allowed app-based cab aggregators including Ola, Uber and Rapido to operate autos until the state government fixes fares. The companies can temporarily charge 10% of base fare as a convenience fee along with 5% of GST. The interim decision comes against the state government's directive which asked ride-hailing apps to discontinue auto services in Bengaluru.
data.title: K'taka HC allows cab aggregators to operate autos until govt fixes fares

data.author: Anisha Joneja
data.content: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raised $200,000 in a seed funding round led by Freeflow Venture Builders and saw participation from high net worth individuals like Sanjay Nagi and Sharan Parikh. It was founded in 2020 by Swapnil Manish, Anuradha Sinha and Sanket Khemuka. PlayCKC was among four startups in the first sports-tech cohort by India Accelerator and JSW Sports.
data.title: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raises $200,000 in seed funding

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Edtech startup Byju's standalone business, comprising K-12 (kindergarten to class 12) offerings, posted a loss of ₹2,702.14 crore in FY21 against a profit of ₹7.39 crore in FY20 with revenues falling over 30% during the year, the company's recent filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs showed. Revenue from operations fell to ₹1,378.51 crore from ₹1,918.25 crore a year earlier.
data.title: Byju's standalone business posted loss in FY21 with 30% revenue drop

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: Shiprocket and OneCard are the only two Indian startups to turn unicorn in Q3 2022 amid slowdown in funding, PwC India reported. The July-September period produced 20 unicorns globally and 45% of them were from SaaS segment. "The global slowdown in funding continues with startup funding in India in Q3 CY22 hitting two-year low at $2.7 billion," the report added.
data.title: Only 2 Indian startups turned unicorn in Q3 amid slow funding: PwC

data.author: Purnima Rajput
data.content: Electric vehicle maker Ather Energy has secured ₹400.6 crore in a funding round led by Caladium Investment which invested ₹400 crore, according to Registrar of Companies' filings. The funding round also saw participation from Herald Square Ventures which pumped in ₹64 lakh. In May 2022, the startup had raised around ₹991 crore in a Series E funding round.
data.title: Ather Energy raises ₹400.6 crore in Caladium Investment-led round
